segments.text: I see the water from the sink just pouring out onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s spreading everywhere, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the cabinets are going to get ruined from all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with the cookies to notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger and bigger by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless everyone is being right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just cascading down the cabinet doors like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is going to end badly if someone doesn’t do something soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
